channel.title: Links on tracker
channel.description: Recent content in Links on tracker

item.title: links for 2008-05-22
item.description:
• Rustbelt Intellectual: GREEN ACRES HERE I COME
    Brownfields are becoming greenfields, rubble strewn vacant lots are becoming gardens, and many cities now have neighborhood-based agribusinesses. Urban farmers are remaking parts of most Rustbelt cities.
    (tags: via:cshalizi ubifarm urbifarm deindustrialization agriculture food victory-gardens rustbelt philadelphia detroit)
  • Weirdness facilitation | Science Blogs
    "bizarre behavior is just an emergent property of large groups of humans given the ability to communicate over long distances"
    (tags: emergence high-weirdness-by-email proximity)
  • Anyterm - Introduction
    telnet from a web browser window, either hosted or on your own system. play your favorite vt100 games!
    (tags: anyterm terminal telnet protocol-translation ssh vt100)
  • Bastet (Tetris clone) running in Anyterm terminal emulation window
    Anyterm is a web-based terminal emulator; in this demo, we see it running Bastet, a Tetris clone.
    (tags: anyterm bastet tetris vt100 vt100-forever terminal telnet games)
  • Minddriven: The fastest ToDo List is a ToDo Album ...
    When I see something that needs to be fixed (something to buy, to repair, to clean, to move), I take a snapshot of it.
    (tags: ubicam todo productivity gtd visual-memory observation coverflow)
  • The naysayer’s timeline of technology in the workplace.
    Whenever someone doesn't want to adopt a new technology, and doesn't want to think very hard about why, the common questions they post are: "What's the ROI? What's the use case? Who else is doing it?"
    (tags: business culture internet dr-no just-say-no bad-idea dont-go-there trailing-indicator no no-no no-no-1000-times-no corporate)
  • Park Advisory Commission Unanimously Supports Ann Arbor Skatepark Location
    a HUGE thanks to the 125+ people who came out to the Park Advisory Commission (PAC) public hearing in support of the Ann Arbor skatepark location. The city council chambers were full, with standing room only. The PAC members were visibly surprised, and th
    (tags: annarbor skatepark park skateboard skateboarding-is-not-a-crime)
  • swhack irc 2004-02-10
    "I suggest adopting some of the non-ridiculous blogger terms: wikisphere, wikiverse, wikiroll, mowiki, warwiki, wikirati, wikistan, wikipundit, and so on. Also, those wiki people should start using terms like "anti-idiotarian" in their writing."
    (tags: wikisphere wikiverse wikiroll mowiki warwiki wikirati wikistan wikipundit wikipedant language irc)
  • Open the Future: the sheer banality of tomorrow, the flow of inevitability
    The distribution of the future is less an endeavor of conscious advancement than it is an epidemiological process -- a pandemic of tomorrows, if you will.
    (tags: future futurism via:preoccupations retrofuturism history)
  • Shelf Talk
    seattle public library blog about books; you library-school people will recognize the "readers advisory" genre
    (tags: blog library book books reviews readers-advisory lists)

item.title: links for 2008-04-22
item.description:
• Alan’s Blogometer: Burn Your Feed Reader
    How to bail out of Google Reader and other news readers - avoid the feed, browse instead.
    (tags: feed feeds productivity reader-zero)
  • blog.plazes.com » Blog Archive » Plazes adds Fire Eagle Support
    Automated self-surveillance; never be alone, everyone knows where you are. Sure, it's a neat technology hack, but do you want to be part of it?
    (tags: geo mobile plazes)

item.title: links for 2008-04-02
item.description:

    photos, lists and reviews of long-gone restaurants in Ann Arbor
    (tags: annarbor food restauarants reviews arborwiki aadl lost-ann-arbor)
  • Virgle: The Adventure of Many Lifetimes
    "luxury cruise to mars" - Google has been testing this Adwords copy for a long time
    (tags: luxury-cruise-to-mars)
  • More Frog Postcards From Finland
    These are all Carte Blanche Greetings Ltd. Linnapaperi Oy Puh. 014-621035.
    (tags: frog postcard finland)
  • ERCB: DDJ Programmer's Bookshelf April 1993
    Small wonder that the Known Net of the distant future is also referred to by its users as "The Net of a Million Lies."

item.title: links for 2008-03-18
item.description:
• Scholz - Web 2.0 from an East German point of view
    If the TV news reports on East German television seemed outlandish to tourists, I wonder what the precarity of the labor dynamic of Web 2.0 and its hyperlocal news would look like to a visitor from a country that is not afflicted by capitalism. They would
    (tags: 2008 analysis web2.0 web20 essay firstmonday ossi)
  • Remembering Jean-Claude Vrinat. - By Mike Steinberger - Slate Magazine
    Vrinat and his staff went about their work with a serene perfectionism; no detail escaped their notice, but they made flawlessness look easy and fun. Above all, they were guided by a determination to send every client home satiated, smiling, and happy.
    (tags: attention detail food service paris restaurant)
  • Pay Attention to Detail by Alain Burrese
    Three basic steps can help make your practice more efficient and less stressful: (1) organizing your desk, office and practice; (2) implementing uniform systems to ensure accuracy; and (3) avoiding inattentiveness due to familiarity and routine work.
    (tags: attention detail organization systems familiarity routine)
  • Bad moods assist attention | COSMOS magazine
    "If attention is like a spotlight, then a good mood will widen that spotlight, while a negative mood will focus it very tightly," said Adam Anderson, assistant professor of psychology at the University of Toronto in Canada and author of the study.
    (tags: attention detail mood focus creativity psychology)
  • Personality Traits of the Best Software Developers | Software by Rob
    I have never, ever, ever seen a great software developer who does not have amazing attention to detail.
    (tags: attention detail programming productivity development software)
  • ATTENTION TO DETAIL
    "checklist, review, accuracy. orderly, errors, omissions, precise, thorough"
    (tags: attention detail)
  • Relish :: Marching towards FestiFools 2008 // Downtown Ann Arbor, Exhibition, Festifools, Flickr, Mark Tucker, Parade, Puppets, Rich, Street Art, Sweetwaters, Thanks, University Of Michigan
    On Sunday, April 6 from 4–5pm, giant, fanciful puppets (and foolish co-conspirators) will once again descend upon downtown Ann Arbor, and dance like there’s no tomorrow.
    (tags: festifools april annarbor michigan puppets parade)
  • Welcome to Clueray > focus your search
    search engine filters results via additional criteria
    (tags: search clueray)
  • N2Y3 Mashup Challenge Project Gallery | NetSquared, a project of TechSoup.org
    Vote for your favorite Mashups until March 21 at 5:00pm Pacific Time. Find projects of interest and give them feedback.
    (tags: innovation activism mashups netsquared n2y3)

item.title: links for 2008-03-06
item.description:
• Whitesalls on the web
    (tags: chelsea michigan blogs)
  • Science Fiction Oral History Association - SFOHA
    awesome project to collect and digitize and distribute archives of oral histories of the science fiction world.
    (tags: history scifi audio recordings mp3 podcast archives)
  • Shorty
    Shorty is a simple tool for creating shorter, human- readable links from long URLs. You install Shorty on your server, so the links you create with it never go away. You can also manage your links and see how often people click on them
    (tags: tinyurl php stats redirect)
  • Workplace Experiments - (37signals)
    we discussed how we could make 37signals one of the best places in the world to work, learn, and generally be happy.
    (tags: happiness lifehacks management productivity)
  • "A Godlike Presence": The Impact of Radio on the 1920s and 1930s | Tom Lewis | OAH Magazine of History
    Much of the information in this paper comes from my book Empire of the Air: The Men Who Created Radio (New York, HarperCollins, 1991).
    (tags: radio technology broadcasting party-like-its-192x party-like-its-193x)

item.title: links for 2008-02-16
item.description:
• Michigan Libraries in postcards
    Much information comes from a recent discovery, Carnegie Libraries in Michigan. Most of the postcards below are of Carnegie buildings.
    (tags: michigan library postcard superpatron)
  • The Inconvienent Truth About Social Media Marketing
    "Social media traffic does not monetize." or, how people with a limited understanding of the short term and long term value they are building mis-measure the long term strategic value of being in the center of a dense network
    (tags: advertising media socialmedia marketing seo eyeballs party-like-its-1999)
  • Arbor puts the cap on Ellacoya buy - Mass High Tech: The Journal of New England Technology:
    Arbor Networks Inc., a maker of network security products for service providers, has completed its acquisition of New Hampshire's Ellacoya Networks Inc., officials said.
    (tags: arbor-networks ellacoya annarbor michigan merger acquisition)
  • Google, students from EMU team up - Latest from the Ann Arbor News - MLive.com
    "The goal is to create a class of professionals who understand the Internet business ecosystem," said Bud Gibson, the EMU business professor who runs the course.
    (tags: emu eastern-michigan ypsilanti annarbor michigan google teh-google adwords)
  • Developers acquire more of downtown Ypsilanti - Latest from the Ann Arbor News - MLive.com
    The buildings have been home to a variety of businesses over the years, but they are well known for housing the Dawson Lumber company and Mack and Mack furniture store.
    (tags: ypsilanti michigan dawson-lumber mack-and-mack development arborwiki)
  • U-M prof loses bid for president of Czech Republic - Latest from the Ann Arbor News - MLive.com
    PRAGUE, Czech Republic ⊘- University of Michigan Professor Jan Svejnar was unsuccessful today in his bid to become president of the Czech Republic, as incumbent Vaclav Klaus was reelected for a five-year term.
    (tags: annarbor michigan umich prague czech-republic jan-svejnar vaclav-klaus)
  • U-M to revamp stately Stockwell Hall - Latest from the Ann Arbor News - MLive.com
    When University of Michigan students return to Stockwell Hall in the fall of 2009, they'll find air conditioned rooms, new bathrooms and new common space envisioned as a place for them to relax and study.
    (tags: annarbor michigan stockwell umich rennovation construction arborwiki)
  • REI: Ann Arbor
    REI—Ann Arbor - Coming soon! Drop in, gear up, and go explore the fantastic recreational opportunities available in the Ann Arbor area
    (tags: rei annarbor coming-soon stores clothing watch-out-cabelas michigan)
  • Michigan, Florida votes could be crucial for Democrats - CNN.com
    "If there's a way of organizing something in those states where both Sen. Clinton and I can compete and we have enough time to make our case before the voters there, then that would be fine," Obama has said. Clinton supporters, meanwhile, say that's unfa
    (tags: clinton obama michigan florida vote-early-vote-often election08)
  • N2Y3 Mashup Challenge | NetSquared, a project of TechSoup.org
    This year’s NetSquared Conference will bring together a unique mix of people from the public and private sectors to develop and release Mashups designed to provide deeper insight into the social issues affecting communities around the globe.
    (tags: challenge change competition contest development mashup netsquared nptech nonprofit social)
  • Getting to know our clients - Arbor Teas awakens Pure Visibility’s inner tea party | Own Page One: Search Engine Visibility Blog - Online Marketing Strategy and Tips
    tea time!
    (tags: purevisibility tea annarbor)
  • Evolving Web: Rethinking Marketing
    How did I hear about this article? Social Media. Ed Vielmetti "for:"ed it to me. Jim Benson on the many ways that marketing and social media intersect.
    (tags: via:ourfounder socialmedia digg delicious marketing)
  • Talkback on Library Journal
    I love it. This article is the perfect apocalyptical anti-valentine. I don't think I have ever read an article that has me cursing one minute, and nodding my head in agreement the next.
    (tags: library librarian biblioapocalpyse-now superpatron library-rants)
  • I Love You, but You Love Meat - New York Times
    who, like her, is an adventurous and omnivorous eater. Now, she said, she could not be happier. “A relationship is about giving and receiving, and he loves what I cook, and I love to cook for him,” she said.
    (tags: funny nyt food recipes diet omnivores-make-better-lovers)
  • SandHill.com | Opinion : SaaS + Sales Performance Management = Recession Resilience
    "SaaS means no upfront hardware and software costs, no worrying about costly ongoing software maintenance, and no vendor lock in." instead you worry about your vendor!
    (tags: saas salesforce s3 vendor-relationship-management all-eggs one-basket watch-the-basket)
  • NPR: Alternative 'Commie' High Mellows with Time
    Community High School in Ann Arbor, Mich., has offered children in this progressive city an alternative to traditional high school since 1972.
    (tags: audio creativity culture local annarbor michigan commie-high)
  • Research | pjlamber@umich.edu
    In particular, my current research focuses on social processes governed by positive feedbacks such as product competition under increasing returns, innovation diffusion and social learning. I am especially interested in implications of positive feedback
    (tags: feedback competition innovation)
  • Feedback Loop: Principia Cybernetica Web on Feedback Loops
    with commentary from bentrem: "dialectic, discourse, open access, and decision-making concerning public policy"
    (tags: gnodal public-policy discourse dialog)

item.title: links for 2008-02-11
item.description:
• Johns Hopkins University Press | Books | The Mantra of Efficiency
    beneath efficiency's seemingly endless variety lies a common theme: the pursuit of mastery through techniques of surveillance, discipline, and control.
    (tags: efficiency productivity gtd surveillance control management disciple)
  • Online with Wireless Ypsi | Common Monkeyflower
    Of, course, now that Ed Vielmetti has picked up the scent, it should be all of five minutes before he's mobilized 1,000 Ann Arborites to do us one better. But, for the moment, Dear Ann Arbor: nyah nyah!
    (tags: ypsi ypsilanti wireless-ypsi wifi meraki nyah-nyah ypsi-shows-the-way)
  • LA Weekly - Eat+Drink - The Bacon-Wrapped Hot Dog: So Good It's Illegal - Daniel Hernandez - The Essential Online Resource for Los Angeles
    You can smell one from blocks away. The grilled bacon, twisted around a wiener, is topped with grilled onions and a mountaintop of diced tomatoes, ketchup, mustard and mayonnaise. Then one whole grilled green poblano chile is plopped impossibly on top.
    (tags: awesome cuisine culture food law losangeles recipes bacon hotdog not-vegan so-very-not-vegan la)

    (tags: bus transmission allison hybrid aata annarbor michigan theride)

    (tags: ypsilanti history photos archives arborwiki ypsiwiki michigan ypsi)

  • NEWCITYCHICAGO.COM: Street Smart Chicago | Manny's
    Though he’s a native-born Chicagoan, my 8-month-old son’s middle name is Detroit. My wife and I figured if he became a rock star, he could just drop his guttural Slavic surname, and he’d have the perfect pseudonym: Grayson Detroit.
    (tags: chicago deli food nostalgia detroit)
